member.summary: Allocates memory from native heap of this process using heap API. Uses the common heap of this process, API GetProcessHeap. Usually slightly faster than Marshal class functions.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Util.NativeHeap.Alloc(Catkeys.Types.LPARAM,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allocates new memory block and returns its address. Calls API HeapAlloc.
member.param: Byte count.
Set all bytes = 0. If false (default), the memory is uninitialized, ie random byte values. Slower when true.
member.exception: Failed. Probably size is too big.
member.remarks: The memory is unmanaged and will not be freed automatically. Always call when done or if need to resize it without losing data.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Util.NativeHeap.ReAlloc(System.Void*,Catkeys.Types.LPARAM,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reallocates a memory block to make it bigger or smaller. Returns its address, which in most cases is different than the old memory block address. Preserves data in Math.Min(old size, new size) bytes of old memory (copies from old memory if need). Calls API HeapReAlloc or HeapAlloc.
member.param: Old memory address. If null, allocates new memory like Alloc.
New byte count.
When size is growing, set all added bytes = 0. If false (default), the added memory is uninitialized, ie random byte values. Slower when true.
member.exception: Failed. Probably size is too big.
member.remarks: The memory is unmanaged and will not be freed automatically. Always call when done or ReAlloc if need to resize it without losing data.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Util.NativeHeap.Free(System.Void*)
member.summary: Frees a memory block. Does nothing if mem is null. Calls API HeapFree.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Util.Buffers
member.summary: Allocates memory buffers that can be used with API functions and not only. Can allocate arrays of any value type - char[], byte[] etc.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Util.Buffers.Get``1(System.Int32,System.WeakReference{``0[]}@)
member.summary: Allocates new or gets "cached" array of type T of length n or more. The returned array is managed by a WeakReference<T[]> variable provided by the caller. Its contents is undefined.
member.typeparam: Any value type, for example char, byte, RECT.
member.param: How many elements you need. If array in the WeakReference variable is null or too small, creates new array and stores it there. For byte[] and char[] types actually allocates Math.Max(n, 300)+1 elements. The 300 is to avoid future reallocations. The +1 can be used for example for '\0' character at the end of string.

A reference to a WeakReference variable that manages the returned array. If null, this function will create it. The variable should be [ThreadStatic] static. Or can be a non-static field of a long-living object. Must not be simply static, it's not thread-safe (unless locked).
member.remarks: Used to avoid creating much garbage when array allocations are needed frequently. Also is faster than code like var b=new byte[1000] or StringBuilder. The WeakReference variable allows the array to be garbage-collected if it is not used when GC runs. It is automatic and safe. Next time this function will create new array. Actually this function is a wrapper for WeakReference<T[]> functions TryGetTarget/SetTarget. Makes it easier to use.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Util.LibStringBuilderCache
member.summary: Provides a cached reusable instance of StringBuilder per thread. It's an optimisation that reduces the number of instances constructed and collected. This is a modified copy of the .NET internal StringBuilderCache class.

member.name: F:Catkeys.Util.LibStringBuilderCache.MAX_BUILDER_SIZE
member.summary: 2000. Acquire does not use the cache if requested capacity is bigger. Release does not use the cache if StrinBuilder capacity is bigger.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Util.LibStringBuilderCache.Acquire(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets a StringBuilder of the specified capacity. When finished using it, call .
member.remarks: Can be called any number of times. If a StringBuilder of good capacity is in the cache then it will be returned and the cache emptied. Subsequent calls will return a new StringBuilder. A single StringBuilder instance is cached as a [ThreadLocal] field.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Util.LibStringBuilderCache.Release(System.Text.StringBuilder)
member.summary: Releases a StringBuilder acquired with to the cache. The same as , but does not call ToString().
member.remarks: Places the StringBuilder in the cache if it is not too big. The variable then should not be used. Unbalanced Acquire/Release (or Acquire/ToStringCached_) are perfectly acceptable. It will merely cause to create a new StringBuilder next time Acquire is called.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Util.ThreadPoolSTA.Work.Wait
member.summary: Waits until all submitted instances of the callback function finish their work. While waiting, this thread cannot dispatch events and Windows messages.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Util.ThreadPoolSTA.Work.Cancel
member.summary: Waits until all running instances of the callback function finish their work, and cancels pending (still not running) instances. While waiting, this thread cannot dispatch events and Windows messages.

member.summary: Calls , releases all resources used by this object and allows this object to be garbage-collected. Call this to avoid memory leaks. If not called, the object and related OS object remain in memory until this appdomain ends.

Possibly also will need for some other windows.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Util.LibActCtx

member.name: T:Catkeys.InterDomainVariables
member.summary: Inter-domain variables. Allows to share values by all app domains of this process. Similar to environment variables, but supports more types and does not inherit parent process variables; the speed is similar. Supports not all types. The type must have one of these properties: 1. Derived from MarshalByRefObject. The stored value is a virtual reference (proxy), not a copy. The owner domain must be still alive when other domains access (call methods etc) the retrieved value, else AppDomainUnloadedException. 2. Has [Serializable] attribute. The stored value is a copy, not reference. For example int, IntPtr, string, arrays, List, Dictionary.

member.name: M:Catkeys.InterDomainVariables.SetVariable(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds or modifies an inter-domain variable.
member.param: Name. Can be any unique string, for example a GUID string. Case-sensitive.
Value.
member.exception: The type is not supported because is neither serializable nor MarshalByRefObject-derived.

member.name: M:Catkeys.InterDomainVariables.GetVariable(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of an inter-domain variable. Returns null if the variable does not exist. Else returns the value as object; need a cast.
member.param: Name. Case-sensitive.

member.name: M:Catkeys.InterDomainVariables.GetVariable``1(System.String,``0@)
member.summary: Gets the value of an inter-domain variable. Returns true if the variable exists and is not null.
member.param: Name. Case-sensitive.
Receives the value. If the variable does not exist, receives the default value of that type (for reference types it is null).

member.name: M:Catkeys.InterDomainVariables.GetVariable``1(System.String,System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Gets the value of an inter-domain variable. If the variable does not exist or is null, calls a callback function that provides an initial value; then sets the variable = the initial value. Thread-safe.
member.param: Name. Case-sensitive.
A callback function delegate (eg lambda) that is called when the variable does not exist or is null. It must return an initial value.
member.exception: The type is not supported because is neither serializable nor MarshalByRefObject-derived.
member.remarks: Be careful with types derived from MarshalByRefObject. If the object does not exist, your callback function creates it in this appdomain. Maybe this appdomain is not where you want it to live. Instead use SetVariable and another overload of GetVariable.

example.code: int test = InterDomainVariables.GetVariable("test", () => 10);

member.name: M:Catkeys.InterDomainVariables.DefaultDomainVariable``1(System.String,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Gets a reference to an object that lives in default appdomain. Auto-creates new object there if does not exist. The object can be used in any appdomain. When a non-default domain calls its methods, the call is marshaled to the default domain and executed there.
member.typeparam: The type must be derived from MarshalByRefObject and have default constructor.
member.param: Inter-domain variable name. Any unique string. Case-sensitive.
Receives true if now created new object, false if the object alrady existed.
member.remarks: Thread-safe.

member.name: M:Catkeys.InterDomainVariables.DefaultDomainVariable``1(System.String)
member.summary: The same as , just does not have the bool parameter.

member.name: T:Catkeys.ScriptOptions
member.summary: Options for some often used automation functions.
member.remarks:
Used like this:
This library has functions
Usually function options are specified using either function parameters or class properties. As you know, many functions allow to adjust their behavior through some kind of options (aka settings, flags, parameters). There are two common ways to pass options to a function: 1. Function parameters, like Class.Func(other parameters, option1, option2); 2. Class properties, like var x=new Class(); x.Option1=1; x.Option2=2; x.Func(parameters);.

member.name: M:Catkeys.ScriptOptions.#ctor(Catkeys.ScriptOptions)
member.summary: Copies all options from another ScriptOptions object.
member.param: If null, sets default options (unchanged ScriptOptions.Default).

member.name: M:Catkeys.ScriptOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Copies all options from .

member.name: P:Catkeys.ScriptOptions.Default
member.summary: Initial options used for: of all threads of this appdomain; new ScriptOptions objects created like var o=new ScriptOptions();.
member.remarks: Why there are two static ScriptOptions objects - Options and Default: Options - thread-scoped object. Functions of this library use it. You can change its properties in scripts where need. Initial property values are automatically copied from Default when the Options property is accessed first time in that thread. Default - appdomain-scoped object. Contains initial property values for Options and new ScriptOptions objects. Normally you change its properties in script template, at the start of script execution.

member.name: P:Catkeys.ScriptOptions.Options
member.summary: Options of this thread. You can set and get its properties. Functions of this library use it. Initially it is a clone of .

member.name: P:Catkeys.ScriptOptions.MouseClickSleep
member.summary: Wait milliseconds at the end of Mouse.Click() and other functions that generate mouse button or wheel events. Default: 50. Valid values: 0 - 60000 (1 minute).
member.remarks: This option also is applied to: The sleep time after mouse move events is Math.Min(7, MouseClickSleep). The sleep time between mouse button down and up events is Math.Min(20, MouseClickSleep).

member.name: P:Catkeys.ScriptOptions.MouseMoveSpeed
member.summary: If not 0, makes mouse movements slower, not instant. Used by Mouse.Move, Mouse.Click and other functions that generate mouse movement events. Default: 0. Valid values: 0 (instant) - 60000 (slowest).
member.remarks: It is not milliseconds or some other unit. It adds intermediate mouse movements and small delays when moving the mouse cursor to the specified point. The speed also depends on the distance. Value 0 (default) does not add intermediate mouse movements. Adds at least 1 if some mouse buttons are pressed. Value 1 adds at least 1 intermediate mouse movement. Values 10-50 are good for visually slow movements.

member.name: P:Catkeys.ScriptOptions.KeySleep
member.summary: Wait milliseconds at the end of Input.Key() and other functions that generate keyboard events. Default: 50. Valid values: 0 - 60000 (1 minute).

member.name: P:Catkeys.ScriptOptions.KeySpeed
member.summary: Wait milliseconds after each key down and up event in Input.Key() and other functions that generate keyboard events. Default: 0. Valid values: 0 - 60000.
member.remarks: If 0 (default), just sleeps briefly after some keys.

member.name: P:Catkeys.ScriptOptions.Relaxed
member.summary: Make some functions less strict (less checking for possibly invalid conditions). Default: false.
member.remarks:
This option is used by these functions:
Mouse.Move, Mouse.Click and other functions that move the cursor (mouse pointer): false - throw exception if cannot move the cursor to the specified x y. For example it the x y is not in screen. true - try to move anyway. Don't throw exception, regardless of the final cursor position (which probably will be at a screen edge).
Mouse.Move, Mouse.Click and other functions that move the cursor (mouse pointer): false - before moving the cursor, wait while a mouse button is pressed by the user or another thread. It prevents an unintended drag-drop. true - do not wait.
Mouse.Click and other functions that click or press a mouse button using window coordinates: false - don't allow to click in another window. If need, activate the specified window (or its top-level parent). If that does not help, throw exception. However if the window is a control, allow x y anywhere in its top-level parent window. true - allow to click in another window. Don't activate the window and don't throw exception.

member.name: P:Catkeys.ScriptOptions.Debug
member.summary: If true, some library functions may display some debug info that is not displayed if this is false. If not explicitly set, the default value depends on the configuration of the entry assymbly: true if Debug, false if Release.

member.name: M:Catkeys.ScriptOptions.DisableWarnings(System.String[])
member.summary: Disables one or more warnings.
member.param: One or more warnings as case-insensitive wildcard strings. See .
member.remarks: Adds the strings to an internal list. When is called, it looks in the list. If it finds the warning in the list, it does not show the warning. It's easy to auto-restore warnings with 'using', like in the second example. Restoring is optional.

member.name: P:Catkeys.ScriptOptions.Temp
member.summary: Saves current Options so that it will be automatically restored like in the example.
member.remarks: Multiple using(ScriptOptions.Temp) can be nested. Note: Each thread has its own Options. This function saves/restores Options of this thread.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Files
member.summary: File system functions. Works with files and directories. Disk drives like @"C:\" or "C:" are directories too. Extends .NET file system classes such as File and Directory. Many functions of this class can be used instead of existing similar .NET functions that are slow, limited or unreliable. Most functions support only full path. Most of them throw ArgumentException if passed a filename or relative path, ie in "current directory". Using current directory is unsafe; it was relevant only in DOS era. Most functions support extended-length paths (longer than 259). Such local paths should have @"\\?\" prefix, like @"\\?\C:\...". Such network path should be like @"\\?\UNC\server\share\...". See , . Many functions support long paths even without prefix.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Files.Misc
member.summary: Miscellaneous functions.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Files.Misc.FileId
member.summary: Contains file properties that can be used to uniquely identify the file on a single computer. Can be used with files and directories. To get it, use .
member.remarks: Path to the same file or directory can be specified in many different ways. To determine whether two paths represent to the same file, get and compare FileId of them.

member.summary: Temporarily disables file system redirection, to allow this 32-bit process access the 64-bit System32 directory.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Files.Misc.DisableRedirection.Disable
member.summary: If Ver.Is32BitProcessOn64BitOS, calls API Wow64DisableWow64FsRedirection, which disables file system redirection. The caller can call this without checking OS and process bitness. This function checks it and it is fast. Always call or Dispose, for example in finally{}, or use using (this struct implements IDisposable). Not calling it is more dangerous than a memory leak. It is not called by GC.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Files.Misc.DisableRedirection.Revert
member.summary: If redirected, calls API Wow64RevertWow64FsRedirection.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Files.Misc.DisableRedirection.IsSystem64PathIn32BitProcess(System.String)

member.param: Normalized path. This function does not normalize. Also it is unaware of @"\\?\".

member.name: M:Catkeys.Files.Misc.DisableRedirection.GetNonRedirectedSystemPath(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: If Ver.Is32BitProcessOn64BitOS is true and path starts with Folders.System, replaces that path part with . It disables redirection to Folders.SystemX32 for that path.
member.param: Normalized path. This function does not normalize. Also it is unaware of @"\\?\".
Don't replace path if the file or directory exists in the redirected folder or does not exist in the non-redirected folder.

member.summary: Gets file or directory attributes, size and times. Returns false if the file/directory does not exist. Calls API GetFileAttributesEx.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Files.ExistsAs(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets file system entry type - file, directory, and whether it exists. Returns NotFound (0) if does not exist or if fails to get attributes. Calls API GetFileAttributes.
member.param: Full path. Supports @"\.." etc. If useRawPath is false (default), supports environment variables (see ). Can be null.
Pass path to the API as it is, without any normalizing and full-path checking.
member.remarks: Supports . If you need exception when fails, instead call and check attribute Directory. Always use full path. If path is not full: if useRawPath is false (default) returns NotFound; if useRawPath is true, searches in "current directory".

member.name: M:Catkeys.Files.ExistsAs2(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets file system entry type - file, directory, symbolic link, whether it exists and is accessible. Returns NotFound (0) if does not exist. Returns AccessDenied (< 0) if exists but this process cannot access it and get attributes. Calls API GetFileAttributes. The same as but provides more complete result. In most cases you can use ExistsAs, it's simpler.
member.param: Full path. Supports @"\.." etc. If useRawPath is false (default), supports environment variables (see ). Can be null.
Pass path to the API as it is, without any normalizing and full-path checking.
member.remarks: Supports . If you need exception when fails, instead call and check attributes Directory and ReparsePoint. Always use full path. If path is not full: if useRawPath is false (default) returns NotFound; if useRawPath is true, searches in "current directory".

member.name: M:Catkeys.Files.ExistsAsAny(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns true if file or directory exists. Calls , which calls API GetFileAttributes.
member.param: Full path. Supports @"\.." etc. If useRawPath is false (default), supports environment variables (see ). Can be null.
Pass path to the API as it is, without any normalizing and full-path checking.
member.remarks: Supports . If you need exception when fails, instead call . Always use full path. If path is not full: if useRawPath is false (default) returns NotFound; if useRawPath is true, searches in "current directory". For symbolic links etc, returns true if the link exists. Does not care whether its target exists. Unlike and , this function returns true when the file exists but cannot get its attributes. Then ExistsAsAny(path) is not the same as ExistsAsFile(path) || ExistsAsDirectory(path).

member.name: M:Catkeys.Files.ExistsAsFile(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns true if file exists and is not a directory. Returns false if does not exist or if fails to get its attributes. Calls , which calls API GetFileAttributes.
member.param: Full path. Supports @"\.." etc. If useRawPath is false (default), supports environment variables (see ). Can be null.
Pass path to the API as it is, without any normalizing and full-path checking.
member.remarks: Supports . If you need exception when fails, instead call and check attribute Directory. Always use full path. If path is not full: if useRawPath is false (default) returns NotFound; if useRawPath is true, searches in "current directory". For symbolic links etc, returns true if the link exists and its target is not a directory. Does not care whether its target exists.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Files.ExistsAsDirectory(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns true if directory (folder or drive) exists. Returns false if does not exist or if fails to get its attributes. Calls , which calls API GetFileAttributes.
member.param: Full path. Supports @"\.." etc. If useRawPath is false (default), supports environment variables (see ). Can be null.
Pass path to the API as it is, without any normalizing and full-path checking.
member.remarks: Supports . If you need exception when fails, instead call and check attribute Directory. Always use full path. If path is not full: if useRawPath is false (default) returns NotFound; if useRawPath is true, searches in "current directory". For symbolic links etc, returns true if the link exists and its target is a directory. Does not care whether its target exists.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Files.SearchPath(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Finds file or directory and returns full path. Returns null if cannot be found. If the path argument is full path, calls and returns normalized path if exists, null if not. Else searches in these places: 1. dirs, if used. 2. . 3. Calls API SearchPath, which searches in process directory, Windows system directories, current directory, PATH environment variable. The search order depends on API SetSearchPathMode or registry settings. 4. If path ends with ".exe", tries to get path from registry "App Paths" keys.
member.param: Full or relative path or just filename with extension. Supports network paths too.
0 or more directories where to search.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Files.EnumDirectory(System.String,Catkeys.Types.FEFlags,System.Func{Catkeys.Types.FEFile,System.Boolean},System.Action{System.String})
member.summary: Gets names and other info of files and subdirectories in the specified directory. Returns an enumerable collection of objects containing the info. By default gets only direct children. Use flag to get all descendants.
member.param: Full path of the directory.

A callback function to call for each file and subdirectory. If it returns false, the file/subdirectory is not included in results. This can be useful when EnumDirectory is called indirectly, for example by the Copy method. If you call it directly, you can instead skip processing the file in your foreach loop.

A callback function to call when fails to get children of a subdirectory, when using flag . It receives the subdirectory path. It can call and throw an exception. If it does not throw an exception, the enumeration continues as if the directory is empty. If errorHandler not used, then throws exception. Read more in Remarks.
member.exception: directoryPath is invalid path or not full path.
Failed to get children of directoryPath or of a subdirectory. Read more in Remarks.
member.remarks:
Uses API FindFirstFile.
The paths that this function gets are normalized, ie may not start with exact directoryPath string. Expanded environment variables (see ), "..", DOS path etc. Paths longer than have @"\\?\" prefix (see ). For symbolic links and mounted folders, gets info of the link/folder and not of its target.
These errors are ignored: 1. Access denied (usually because of security permissions), unless used flag FailIfAccessDenied. 2. Missing target directory of a symbolic link or mounted folder. When an error is ignored, the function works as if that [sub]directory is empty; does not throw exception and does not call errorHandler.
Enumeration of a subdirectory starts immediately after the subdirectory itself is retrieved.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Files._SafeDeleteExistingDirectory.Rename(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: note: path must be normalized.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Files.Rename(System.String,System.String,Catkeys.Types.IfExists)
member.summary: Renames file or directory.
member.param: Full path.
New name without path. Example: "name.txt".
member.exception: path is not full path (see ). newName is invalid filename.
The file (path) does not exist or cannot be found.
member.remarks: Uses API MoveFileEx.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Files.Move(System.String,System.String,Catkeys.Types.IfExists)
member.summary: Moves (changes path of) file or directory.
member.param: Full path.
New full path. It is not the new parent directory. Use for it.
member.exception: path or newPath is not full path (see ).
The source file (path) does not exist or cannot be found.
member.remarks:
In most cases uses API MoveFileEx. It's fast, because don't need to copy files. In these cases copies/deletes: destination is on another drive; need to merge directories. When need to copy, does not copy the security properties; sets default security properties.
Creates the destination directory if does not exist (see ). If path and newPath share the same parent directory, just renames the file.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Files.MoveTo(System.String,System.String,Catkeys.Types.IfExists)
member.summary: Moves file or directory into another directory.
member.param: Full path.
New parent directory.
member.exception: path or newDirectory is not full path (see ). path is drive. To move drive content, use .
The source file (path) does not exist or cannot be found.
member.remarks:
In most cases uses API MoveFileEx. It's fast, because don't need to copy files. In these cases copies/deletes: destination is on another drive; need to merge directories. When need to copy, does not copy the security properties; sets default security properties.
Creates the destination directory if does not exist (see ).

member.summary: Copies file or directory.
member.param: Full path.
New full path. It is not the new parent directory. Use for it.
Options used when copying directory.
This can be used when copying directory. A callback function to call for each descendant file and subdirectory. If it returns false, the file/subdirectory is not copied.
member.exception: path or newPath is not full path (see ).
The source file (path) does not exist or cannot be found.
member.remarks: Uses API CopyFileEx. On Windows 7 does not copy the security properties; sets default security properties. Does not copy symbolic links (silently skips, no exception) if this process is not admin. Creates the destination directory if does not exist (see ).

member.summary: Copies file or directory into another directory.
member.param: Full path.
New parent directory.
Options used when copying directory.
This can be used when copying directory. A callback function to call for each descendant file and subdirectory. If it returns false, the file/subdirectory is not copied.
member.exception: path or newDirectory is not full path (see ). path is drive. To copy drive content, use .
The source file (path) does not exist or cannot be found.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Files.Delete(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes file or directory. Does nothing if it does not exist (no exception).
member.param: Full path.

Send to the Recycle Bin. If not possible, delete anyway. Why could be not possible: 1. The file is in a removable drive (most removables don't have a recycle bin). 2. The file is too large. 3. The path is too long. 4. The Recycle Bin is not used on that drive (it can be set in the Recycle Bin Properties dialog). 5. This process is non-UI-interactive, eg a service. 6. Unknown reasons. Note: it is much slower. To delete multiple, use .
member.remarks:
If directory, also deletes all its files and subdirectories. If fails to delete some, tries to delete as many as possible. Deletes read-only files too. Does not show any message boxes etc (confirmation, error, UAC consent, progress).
Some reasons why this function can fail: 1. The file is open (in any process). Or a file in the directory is open. 2. This process does not have security permissions to access or delete the file or directory or some of its descendants. 3. The directory is (or contains) the "current directory" (in any process).

member.name: M:Catkeys.Files.Delete(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes multiple files or/and directories. The same as , but faster when using Recycle Bin.
member.param: string array, List or other collection. Full paths.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Files.CalculateDirectorySize(System.String,Catkeys.Types.FEFlags)
member.summary: Calls and returns sum of all file sizes. With default flags, it includes sizes of all descendant files, in this directory and all subdirectories except in inaccessible [sub]directories.
member.param: Full path.
EnumDirectory flags.
member.exception: exceptions. By default, no exceptions if used full path and the directory exists.
member.remarks: This function is slow if the directory is large. Don't use this function for files (throws exception) and drives (instead use , it's fast and includes sizes of Recycle Bin and other protected hidden system directories).

member.name: M:Catkeys.Files.CreateDirectory(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Creates new directory if does not exists. If need, creates missing parent/ancestor directories. Returns true if created new directory, false if the directory already exists. Throws exception if fails.
member.param: Path of new directory.
Optional path of a template directory from which to copy some properties. See API CreateDirectoryEx.
member.remarks: If the directory already exists, this function does nothing, and returns false. Else, at first it creates missing parent/ancestor directories, then creates the specified (path) directory. To create the specified directory, calls API CreateDirectory or CreateDirectoryEx (if templateDirectory is not null).

member.name: T:Catkeys.Shell
member.summary: Windows shell functions. Windows shell manages files, folders (directories), shortcuts and virtual objects such as Control Panel.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Shell.Pidl
member.summary: A Pidl variable holds and manages an ITEMIDLIST pointer. An ITEMIDLIST is a native variable-length structure that represents a file or other shell object and is used by Windows shell API instead of file-system path. With shell API is used ITEMIDLIST pointer (PIDL) as IntPtr. This class has an implicit Pidl-to-IntPtr cast operator and therefore a Pidl variable can be passed to shell API IntPtr parameters. The ITEMIDLIST is in unmanaged memory, therefore this class implements IDisposable.
member.remarks: When calling shell API, virtual objects can be identified only by ITEMIDLIST. Some API also support "parsing name", which usually looks like "::{CLSID-1}\::{CLSID-2}". File-system objects can be identified by path as well as by ITEMIDLIST. URLs can be identified by URL as well as by ITEMIDLIST.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Shell.Pidl.op_Implicit(Catkeys.Shell.Pidl)~System.IntPtr
member.summary: Gets the ITEMIDLIST pointer (PIDL).

member.name: M:Catkeys.Shell.Pidl.#ctor(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Assigns an ITEMIDLIST to this variable.
member.param: ITEMIDLIST pointer (PIDL). It can be created by any API that creates ITEMIDLIST. They allocate the memory with API CoTaskMemAlloc. This variable will finally free it with Marshal.FreeCoTaskMem.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Shell.Pidl.Dispose
member.summary: Frees the ITEMIDLIST with Marshal.FreeCoTaskMem and clears this variable.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Shell.Pidl.Detach
member.summary: Gets the ITEMIDLIST and clears this variable so that it cannot be used and will not free the ITEMIDLIST memory. To free it you can use Marshal.FreeCoTaskMem.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Shell.Pidl.FromString(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts string to ITEMIDLIST and creates new Pidl variable that holds it. Returns null if failed. Note: Pidl is disposable.
member.param: A file-system path or URL or shell object parsing name (see ) or ":: HexEncodedITEMIDLIST" (see ). Supports environment variables (see ).
If failed, throw CatException.
member.exception: Failed, and throwIfFailed is true. Probably invalid s.
member.remarks: Calls SHParseDisplayName, except when string is ":: HexEncodedITEMIDLIST". Never fails if s is ":: HexEncodedITEMIDLIST", even if it creates an invalid ITEMIDLIST.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Shell.Pidl.LibFromString(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: The same as , just returns unmanaged ITEMIDLIST pointer (PIDL). Later need to free it with Marshal.FreeCoTaskMem.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Shell.Pidl.ToShellString(Catkeys.Types.Native.SIGDN,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts the ITEMIDLIST to file path or URL or shell object parsing name or display name, depending on stringType argument. Returns null if this variable does not have an ITEMIDLIST (eg disposed or detached). If failed, returns null or throws exception.
member.param: String format. Often used: Native.SIGDN.SIGDN_NORMALDISPLAY - returns object name without path. It is best to display in UI but cannot be parsed to create ITEMIDLIST again. Native.SIGDN.SIGDN_FILESYSPATH - returns path if the ITEMIDLIST identifies a file system object (file or directory). Else returns null. Native.SIGDN.SIGDN_URL - if URL, returns URL. If file system object, returns its path like "file:///C:/a/b.txt". Else returns null. Native.SIGDN.SIGDN_DESKTOPABSOLUTEPARSING - returns path (if file system object) or URL (if URL) or shell object parsing name (if virtual object eg Control Panel). Note: not all returned parsing names can actually be parsed to create ITEMIDLIST again, therefore usually it's better to use instead.
If failed, throw CatException.
member.remarks: Calls SHGetNameFromIDList.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Shell.Pidl.LibToShellString(System.IntPtr,Catkeys.Types.Native.SIGDN,System.Boolean)
member.summary: The same as , just uses an ITEMIDLIST pointer that is not stored in a Pidl variable.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Shell.Pidl.ToString
member.summary: Converts the ITEMIDLIST to string. If it identifies an existing file-system object (file or directory), returns path. If URL, returns URL. Else returns ":: HexEncodedITEMIDLIST" (see ). Returns null if this variable does not have an ITEMIDLIST (eg disposed or detached).

member.name: M:Catkeys.Shell.Pidl.LibToString(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The same as , just uses an ITEMIDLIST pointer that is not stored in a Pidl variable.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Shell.Pidl.ToHexString
member.summary: Returns string ":: HexEncodedITEMIDLIST". It can be used with some functions of this library, mostly of classes Shell, Shell.Pidl and Icons. Cannot be used with native and .NET functions. Returns null if this variable does not have an ITEMIDLIST (eg disposed or detached).

member.name: M:Catkeys.Shell.Pidl.LibToHexString(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The same as , just uses an ITEMIDLIST pointer that is not stored in a Pidl variable.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Shell.Run(System.String,System.String,Catkeys.Types.SRFlags,Catkeys.Types.SRMoreParams)
member.summary: Runs/opens a program, document, folder, URL, new email, Control Panel item etc. By default returns process id. If used flag WaitForExit, returns process exit code. Returns 0 if did not start new process or did not get process handle, usually because opened the document in an existing process.
member.param: What to run. Can be: Full path of a file or folder. Examples: @"C:\folder\file.txt", Folders.System + "notepad.exe", @"%Folders.System%\notepad.exe". Filename of a file or folder, like "notepad.exe". The function calls . URL. Examples: "http://a.b.c/d", "file:///path". Email, like "mailto:a@b.c". Subject, body etc also can be specified, and Google knows how. Shell object's ITEMIDLIST like ":: HexEncodedITEMIDLIST". See , . Can be used to open virtual folders and items like Control Panel. Shell object's parsing name, like "::{CLSID}". See , . Can be used to open virtual folders and items like Control Panel. To run a Windows Store App, use "shell:AppsFolder\WinStoreAppId" format. Examples: "shell:AppsFolder\Microsoft.WindowsCalculator_8wekyb3d8bbwe!App", "shell:AppsFolder\windows.immersivecontrolpanel_cw5n1h2txyewy!microsoft.windows.immersivecontrolpanel". To discover the string use or Google. Supports environment variables, like @"%TMP%\file.txt". See .
Command line arguments to pass to the program. This function expands environment variables if starts with "%" or "\"%".
Allows to specify more parameters.
member.exception: Failed. For example, the file does not exist.
member.remarks:
It works like when you double-click an icon. It may start new process or not. For example it may just activate window if the program is already running. Uses API ShellExecuteEx. Similar to . The returned process id can be used to find a window of the new process. Example:
Wnd w = WaitFor.WindowActive(10, "*- Notepad", "Notepad", Shell.Run("notepad.exe"));

member.name: M:Catkeys.Shell.TryRun(System.String,System.String,Catkeys.Types.SRFlags,Catkeys.Types.SRMoreParams)
member.summary: Calls and handles exceptions. All parameters are the same. If Run throws exception, shows warning with its Message and returns int.MinValue. This is useful when you don't care whether Run succeeded, for example in CatMenu menu item command handlers. Using try/catch there would not look good. Handles only exception of type CatException. It is thrown when fails, usually when the file does not exist.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Shell.SelectFileInExplorer(System.String)
member.summary: Opens parent folder in Explorer and selects the file. Returns null if fails, for example if the file does not exist.
member.param: Full path of a file or directory or other shell object. Supports @"%environmentVariable%\..." (see ) and "::..." (see ).

member.name: T:Catkeys.Path_
member.summary: Extends the .NET class Path.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.ExpandEnvVar(System.String)
member.summary: If path starts with "%" or "\"%", expands environment variables enclosed in %, else just returns path. Also supports known folder names, like "%Folders.Documents%". More info in Remarks.
member.param: Any string. Can be null.
member.remarks:
Supports known folder names as you can get with class properties. Example: @"%Folders.Documents%\file.txt". Example: @"%Folders.Virtual.ControlPanel%" //gets ":: HexEncodedITEMIDLIST". Usually known folders are used like string path = Folders.Documents + "file.txt". It's easier and faster. However it cannot be used when you want to store paths in text files, registry, etc. Then this feature is useful. To get known folder path, this function calls .
This function is called by many functions of classes Path_, Files, Shell, Icons, some others, therefore all they support environment variables and known folders in path string.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.LibGetEnvVar(System.String)
member.summary: Gets environment variable's value. Returns "" if variable not found. Does not support Folders.X.
member.param: Case-insensitive name. Without %.
member.remarks: Environment variable values cannot be "" or null. Setting empty value removes the variable.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.LibEnvVarExists(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if environment variable exists.
member.param: Case-insensitive name.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.IsFullPath(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if path matches one of these wildcard patterns: @"?:\*" - local path, like @"C:\a\b.txt". Here ? is A-Z, a-z. @"?:" - drive name, like @"C:". Here ? is A-Z, a-z. Note: it is considered full path in this library, but for .NET and Windows API it is not full path. @"\\*" - network path, like @"\\server\share\...". Or has prefix @"\\?\".
member.param: Any string. Can be null.
member.remarks: Supports '/' characters too. Supports only file-system paths. Returns false if path is URL (use instead) or starts with "::". If path starts with "%environmentVariable%", shows warning and returns false. You should at first expand environment variables with or instead use .

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.IsFullPathExpandEnvVar(System.String@)
member.summary: Expands environment variables and calls . Returns true if path matches one of these wildcard patterns: @"?:\*" - local path, like @"C:\a\b.txt". Here ? is A-Z, a-z. @"?:" - drive name, like @"C:". Here ? is A-Z, a-z. Note: it is considered full path in this library, but for .NET and Windows API it is not full path. @"\\*" - network path, like @"\\server\share\...". Or has prefix @"\\?\".
member.param: Any string. Can be null. If starts with '%' character, calls with expanded environment variables (). If it returns true, replaces the passed variable with the expanded path string.
member.remarks: Supports '/' characters too. Supports only file-system paths. Returns false if path is URL (use instead) or starts with "::".

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.GetRootLength(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the length of the drive or network folder part in path, including its separator if any. If the string does not start with a drive or network folder path, returns 0 or prefix length (@"\\?\" or @"\\?\UNC\").
member.param: Full path or any string. Can be null. Should not be "%environmentVariable%\...".
member.remarks: Supports prefixes @"\\?\" and @"\\?\UNC\". Supports separators '\\' and '/'.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.GetUrlProtocolLength(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the length of the URL protocol name (also known as URI scheme) in string, including ':'. If the string does not start with a protocol name, returns 0. URL examples: "http:" (returns 5), "http://www.x.com" (returns 5), "file:///path" (returns 5), "shell:etc" (returns 6). The protocol can be unknown, the function just checks string format, which is an ASCII alpha character followed by one or more ASCII alpha-numeric, '.', '-', '+' characters, followed by ':' character.
member.param: A URL or path or any string. Can be null.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.IsUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if the string starts with a URL protocol name (existing or not) and ':' character. URL examples: "http:", "http://www.x.com", "file:///path", "shell:etc". Calls and returns true if it's not 0.
member.param: A URL or path or any string. Can be null.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.Combine(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Combines two path parts using character '\\'. For example directory path and file name.
member.param: First part. Usually a directory.
Second part. Usually a filename or relative path.
s2 can be full path. If it is, ignore s1 and return s2 with expanded environment variables. If false (default), simply combines s1 and s2.
Call which may prepend @"\\?\" if the result path is very long. Default true.
member.remarks: If s1 and s2 are null or "", returns "". Else if s1 is null or "", returns s2. Else if s2 is null or "", returns s1. Similar to System.IO.Path.Combine. Main differences: does not throw exceptions; has some options. Does not expand environment variables. For it use before, or instead. Path that starts with an environment variable is considerd not full path.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.LibCombine(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Combines two path parts. Unlike , fails if some part is empty or @"\" or if s2 is @"\\". Also does not check s2 full path. If fails, throws exception or returns null (if noException).

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.LibIsSepChar(System.Char)
member.summary: Returns true if character c == '\\' || c == '/'.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_._EndsWithDriveWithoutSep(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns true if ends with ':' preceded by a drive letter, like "C:" or "more\C:", but not like "moreC:".
member.param: Can be null.
Use when want to check drive at a middle, not at the end. Eg returns true if s is @"C:\more" and length is 2.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_._AddRemoveSep(System.String)
member.summary: Ensures that s either ends with a valid drive path (eg @"C:\" but not "C:") or does not end with '\\' or '/' (unless would become empty if removed).
member.param: Can be null.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.Normalize(System.String,System.String,Catkeys.Types.PNFlags)
member.summary: Makes normal full path from path that can contain special substrings etc. The sequence of actions: 1. If path starts with '%' character, expands environment variables (see ). 2. If path is not full path but looks like URL, and used flag CanBeUrl, returns path. 3. If path is not full path, and defaultParentDirectory is not null/"", combines path with ExpandEnvVar(defaultParentDirectory). 4. If path is not full path, throws exception. 5. Calls API GetFullPathName. It replaces '/' to '\\', replaces multiple '\\' to single (where need), processes @"\.." etc, trims spaces, etc. 6. If no flag DoNotExpandDosPath, if contains '~' character, calls API GetLongPathName. It converts short DOS path to normal path, if possible, for example @"c:\progra~1" to @"c:\program files". It is slow. It converts path only if the file exists. 7. If no flag DoNotRemoveEndSeparator, removes '\\' character at the end, unless it is a drive path (eg @"C:\"). 8. Appends '\\' character if ends with a drive name (eg "C:" -> @"C:\"). 9. If no flag DoNotPrefixLongPath, calls , which adds @"\\?\" etc prefix if path is very long.
member.param: Any path.
If path is not full path, combine it with defaultParentDirectory to make full path.
member.exception: path is not full path, and defaultParentDirectory is not used or does not make it full path.
member.remarks: Similar to . Main differences: this function expands environment variables, does not support relative paths, supports @"\\?\very long path", trims '\\' at the end if need, does not throw exceptions when [it thinks that] path is invalid (except when path is not full).

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.LibNormalize(System.String,Catkeys.Types.PNFlags,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Same as , but skips full-path checking. s should be full path. If not full and not null/"", combines with current directory.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.LibExpandDosPath(System.String)
member.summary: Calls API GetLongPathName. Currently does not check whether s contains '~' character. Note: the API is slow.
member.param: Can be null.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.LibNormalizeMinimally(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Prepares path for passing to API that support "..", DOS path etc. Calls ExpandEnvVar, _AddRemoveSep, PrefixLongPathIfNeed. Optionally throws if !IsFullPath(path).
member.exception: Not full path (only if throwIfNotFullPath is true).

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.LibIsShellPath(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if starts with "::".
member.param: Can be null.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.PrefixLongPath(System.String)
member.summary: If path is full path (see ) and does not start with @"\\?\", prepends @"\\?\". If path is network path (like @"\\computer\folder\..."), makes like @"\\?\UNC\computer\folder\...".
member.param: Path. Can be null. Must not start with "%environmentVariable%", this function does not expand it. See .
member.remarks: Windows API kernel functions support extended-length paths, ie longer than 259 characters. But the path must have this prefix. Windows API shell functions don't support it.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.PrefixLongPathIfNeed(System.String)
member.summary: Calls if path is longer than (247).
member.param: Path. Can be null. Must not start with "%environmentVariable%", this function does not expand it. See .

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.UnprefixLongPath(System.String)
member.summary: If path starts with @"\\?\" prefix, removes it. If path starts with @"\\?\UNC\" prefix, removes @"?\UNC\".
member.param: Path. Can be null. Must not start with "%environmentVariable%", this function does not expand it. See .

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_._GetPrefixLength(System.String)
member.summary: If s starts with @"\\?\UNC\", returns 8. Else if starts with @"\\?\", returns 4. Else returns 0.
member.param: Can be null.

member.name: F:Catkeys.Path_.MaxFilePathLength
member.summary: Maximal file (not directory) path length supported by all functions (native, .NET and this library). For longer paths need @"\\?\" prefix. It is supported by most native kernel API (but not shell API) and by most functions of this library.

member.name: F:Catkeys.Path_.MaxDirectoryPathLength
member.summary: Maximal directory path length supported by all functions (native, .NET and this library). For longer paths need @"\\?\" prefix. It is supported by most native kernel API (but not shell API) and by most functions of this library.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.CorrectFileName(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Replaces characters that cannot be used in file names. Also corrects other forms of invalid or problematic filename: trims spaces and other blank characters; replaces "." at the end; prepends "@" if a reserved name like "CON" or "CON.txt"; returns "-" if name is null/empty/whitespace. Returns valid filename. However it can be too long (itself or when combined with a directory path).
member.param: Initial filename.
A string that will replace each invalid character. Default "-".

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.IsInvalidFileName(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if name cannot be used for a file name, eg contains '\\' etc characters or is empty. More info: .
member.param: Any string. Can be null. Example: "name.txt".

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.GetFileName(System.String)
member.summary: Gets filename with extension. Returns "" if there is no filename. Returns null if path is null.
member.param: Path or filename.
member.remarks:
Similar to . Some diferences: does not throw exceptions; if ends with '\\' or '/', gets part before it, eg "B" from @"C:\A\B\". Supports separators '\\' and '/'. Also supports URL and shell parsing names like @"::{CLSID-1}\0\::{CLSID-2}". Example paths and results:
@"C:\A\B\file.txt" -> "file.txt". "file.txt" -> "file.txt". "file" -> "file". @"C:\A\B" -> "B". @"C:\A\B\" -> "B". @"C:\A\/B\/" -> "B". @"C:\" -> "". @"C:" -> "". @"\\network\share" -> "share". @"C:\aa\file.txt:alt.stream" -> "file.txt:alt.stream". "http://a.b.c" -> "a.b.c". "::{A}\::{B}" -> "::{B}". "" -> "". null -> null.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.GetFileNameWithoutExtension(System.String)
member.summary: Gets filename without extension. Returns "" if there is no filename. Returns null if path is null.
member.param: Path or filename.
member.remarks:
Similar to Some diferences: does not throw exceptions; if ends with '\\' or '/', gets part before it, eg "B" from @"C:\A\B\" (then does not remove extension from it because it is a directory name). Supports separators '\\' and '/'. Also supports URL and shell parsing names like @"::{CLSID-1}\0\::{CLSID-2}". Example paths and results:
@"C:\A\B\file.txt" -> "file". "file.txt" -> "file". "file" -> "file". @"C:\A\B" -> "B". @"C:\A\B\" -> "B". @"C:\A\B.B\" -> "B.B". @"C:\" -> "". @"C:" -> "". @"\\network\share" -> "share". @"C:\aa\file.txt:alt.stream" -> "file.txt:alt". "http://a.b.c" -> "a.b". "::{A}\::{B}" -> "::{B}". "" -> "". null -> null.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.GetExtension(System.String)
member.summary: Gets filename extension, like ".txt". Returns "" if there is no extension. Returns null if path is null.
member.param: Path or filename.
member.remarks: Supports separators '\\' and '/'. Like , but does not throw exceptions.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.GetExtension(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Gets filename extension and path part without the extension. More info: .
member.param: Path or filename.
Receives path part without the extension. Can be the same variable as path.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.GetDirectoryPath(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes filename part from path. By default also removes separator ('\\' or '/') if it is not after drive name (eg "C:"). Returns "" if the string is a filename. Returns null if the string is a root (like @"C:\" or "C:" or @"\\server\share" or "http:"). Returns null if the string is null.
member.param: Path or filename.
Don't remove the separator character(s) ('\\' or '/'). Examples: from @"C:\A\B" gets @"C:\A\", not @"C:\A"; from "http://x.y" gets "http://", not "http:".
member.remarks:
Similar to . Some diferences: does not throw exceptions; skips '\\' or '/' at the end (eg from @"C:\A\B\" gets @"C:\A", not @"C:\A\B"); does not expand DOS path; much faster. Parses raw string. You may want to it at first. Supports separators '\\' and '/'. Also supports URL and shell parsing names like @"::{CLSID-1}\0\::{CLSID-2}". Example paths and results (withSeparator=false):
@"C:\A\B\file.txt" -> @"C:\A\B". "file.txt" -> "". @"C:\A\B\" -> @"C:\A". @"C:\A\/B\/" -> @"C:\A". @"C:\" -> null. @"\\network\share" -> null. "http:" -> null. @"C:\aa\file.txt:alt.stream" -> "C:\aa". "http://a.b.c" -> "http:". "::{A}\::{B}" -> "::{A}". "" -> "". null -> null.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.LibIsExtension(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if s is like ".ext" and the ext part does not contain characters ".\\/:".
member.param: Can be null.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.LibIsProtocol(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if s is like "protocol:" and not like "c:" or "protocol:more".
member.param: Can be null.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.MakeUnique(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets path with unique filename for a new file or directory. If the specified path is of an existing file or directory, returns path where the filename part is modified like "file 2.txt", "file 3.txt" etc. Else returns unchanged path.
member.param: Suggested full path.
The path is for a directory. The number is always appended at the very end, not before .extension.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Folders
member.summary: Gets known/special folder paths (Desktop, Temp, etc).
member.remarks:
For return values is used type , not string. It is implicitly convertible to string. Its operator + appends a filename or relative path string, with @"\" separator if need. Example: string s = Folders.Desktop + "file.txt"; //C:\Users\Name\Desktop\file.txt If a function cannot get folder path, the return value contains null string. Then the + operator would throw CatException.
Some folders are known only on newer Windows versions or only on some computers. Some property-get functions have a suffix like "_Win8" which means that the folder is unavailable on older Windows. Some known folders, although supported and registerd, may be still not created.
Some folders are virtual, for example Control Panel. They don't have a file system path, but can be identified by an unmanaged array called "ITEMIDLIST" or "PIDL". Functions of the nested class return it as . Functions of the nested class return it as string ":: HexEncodedITEMIDLIST" that can be used with some functions of this library (of classes Shell, Shell.Pidl, Icons) but not with .NET or native functions.
Most functions use Windows "Known Folders" API, such as SHGetKnownFolderPath. The list of Windows predefined known folders: KNOWNFOLDERID. Names of folders specific to this application have "This" prefix, like ThisApp.
Some paths depend on the bitness (32 or 64 bit) of the OS and this process. The example paths below are for English versions of Windows on most computers.
32-bit Windows
System, SystemX86, SystemX64: @"C:\WINDOWS\system32" ProgramFiles, ProgramFilesX86, ProgramFilesX64: @"C:\Program Files" ProgramFilesCommon, ProgramFilesCommonX86, ProgramFilesCommonX64: @"C:\Program Files\Common Files"
64-bit Windows, 64-bit process
System, SystemX64: @"C:\WINDOWS\system32" SystemX86: @"C:\WINDOWS\SysWOW64" ProgramFiles, ProgramFilesX64: @"C:\Program Files" ProgramFilesX86: @"C:\Program Files (x86)" ProgramFilesCommon, ProgramFilesCommonX64: @"C:\Program Files\Common Files" ProgramFilesCommonX86: @"C:\Program Files (x86)\Common Files"
64-bit Windows, 32-bit process
System: @"C:\WINDOWS\system32". However the OS in most cases redirects this path to @"C:\WINDOWS\SysWOW64". SystemX86: @"C:\WINDOWS\SysWOW64" SystemX64: @"C:\WINDOWS\Sysnative". The OS redirects it to the true @"C:\WINDOWS\system32". It is a special path that you don't see in Explorer. ProgramFiles, ProgramFilesX86: @"C:\Program Files (x86)" ProgramFilesX64: @"C:\Program Files" ProgramFilesCommon, ProgramFilesCommonX86: @"C:\Program Files (x86)\Common Files" ProgramFilesCommonX64: @"C:\Program Files\Common Files"

member.name: P:Catkeys.Folders.Temp
member.summary: Temp folder (temporary files) of this user account.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Folders.ThisApp
member.summary: Folder containing assemblies of this appdomain. Calls .
member.remarks: Unlike , this path can be different for each appdomain; it is set when creating the AppDomain. See also , it gets full path (with file name) of appdomain's entry assembly.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Folders.ThisAppTemp
member.summary: Gets or sets path of the temporary files folder of this application. Default is Folders.Temp + Application.ProductName. The 'set' function does not change system settings, it just remembers a string that will be later returned by the 'get' function in this appdomain. The 'get' function creates the folder if does not exist.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Folders.ThisAppDocuments
member.summary: Gets or sets path of user document files folder of this application. Default is Folders.Documents + Application.ProductName. The 'set' function does not change system settings, it just remembers a string that will be later returned by the 'get' function in this appdomain. The 'get' function creates the folder if does not exist.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Folders.ThisAppData
member.summary: Gets or sets path of private files folder of this application on this user account. Default is Folders.RoamingAppData + Application.ProductName. The 'set' function does not change system settings, it just remembers a string that will be later returned by the 'get' function in this appdomain. The 'get' function creates the folder if does not exist.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Folders.ThisAppDataLocal
member.summary: Gets or sets path of local (non-roaming) private files folder of this application on this user account. Default is Folders.LocalAppData + Application.ProductName. The 'set' function does not change system settings, it just remembers a string that will be later returned by the 'get' function in this appdomain. The 'get' function creates the folder if does not exist.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Folders.ThisAppDataCommon
member.summary: Gets or sets path of common (all users) private files folder of this application. Default is Folders.ProgramData + Application.ProductName. The 'set' function does not change system settings, it just remembers a string that will be later returned by the 'get' function in this appdomain. Note: the ProgramData folder has special permissions. Programs running not as administrator usually cannot write there. This function does not auto-create the folder; usually it is created when installing the application.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Folders.ThisProcess
member.summary: Folder containing the program file of this process. Calls . Unlike , this path is the same for all app domains of this process.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Folders.ThisAppImages
member.summary: Gets or sets path of images (icons etc) folder of this application. Default is ThisApp + "Images". Functions of these classes will look for image there: Icons, CatMenu, CatBar, possibly some other.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Folders.SystemX64
member.summary: Gets non-redirected path of the System32 folder.
member.remarks: If this process is 32-bit and OS is 64-bit, when it uses the folder path (@"C:\WINDOWS\system32"), the OS in most cases redirects it to @"C:\Windows\SysWOW64", which contains 32-bit versions of program files. Use SystemX64 when you want to avoid the redirection and access the true System32 folder which on 64-bit OS contains 64-bit program files. More info in class help.

member.name: M:Catkeys.CatMenu.Submenu(System.String,System.Object,System.Action{Catkeys.Types.MTClickArgs})
member.summary: Adds new item (ToolStripMenuItem) that will open a submenu. Then the add-item functions will add items to its submenu. Can be used in 2 ways: 1. using(m.Submenu(...)) { add items; }. See example. 2. m.Submenu(...); add items; m.EndSubmenu();. See .
member.param: Text.
The same as with .
Lambda etc function to be called when the menu item clicked. Rarely used.
member.remarks: Submenus inherit these properties of the main menu, set before adding submenus (see example): BackgroundImage, BackgroundImageLayout, ContextMenu, Cursor, Font, ForeColor, ImageList, ImageScalingSize, Renderer, ShowCheckMargin, ShowImageMargin.

member.name: M:Catkeys.CatMenu.EndSubmenu
member.summary: Call this to end adding items to the current submenu if Submenu() was called without 'using' and without a callback function that adds submenu items.

member.name: T:Catkeys.CatMenu.UsingSubmenu
member.summary: Allows to use code: using(m.Submenu("Name")) { add items; } .

member.name: P:Catkeys.CatMenu.UsingSubmenu.MenuItem
member.summary: Gets ToolStripMenuItem of the submenu-item.

member.name: M:Catkeys.CatMenu.UsingSubmenu.Dispose
member.summary: Calls m.EndSubmenu().

member.name: M:Catkeys.CatMenu.Submenu(System.String,System.Action{Catkeys.CatMenu},System.Object,System.Action{Catkeys.Types.MTClickArgs})

The same as with .

member.name: P:Catkeys.CatMenu.CurrentAddMenu
member.summary: Gets ToolStripDropDownMenu of the main menu or submenu where currently m.Add(...), m[...]=, m.Separator() and m.Submenu(...) would add new item.
member.remarks: Initially it is the main menu. In code of using(m.Submenu(...)) { code; }, m.Submenu(...); code; m.EndSubmenu(); and m.Submenu(..., m1 => { code; }); it is that submenu.

member.name: P:Catkeys.CatMenu.LastMenuItem
member.summary: Gets the last added item as ToolStripMenuItem. Returns null if it is not a ToolStripMenuItem, eg a button or separator. The item can be added with m.Add(...), m[...]= and m.Submenu(...).
member.remarks: You can instead use LastItem, which gets ToolStripItem, which is the base class of all supported item types; cast it to a derived type if need.

member.name: P:Catkeys.CatMenu.MultiShow
member.summary: If false, calls Dispose() when the menu is closed. If true, does not call Dispose(); then you can call Show() multiple times for the same object. Default is false, but is automatically set to true when showing the menu not with CatMenu.Show(), eg when assigned to a control.

member.name: P:Catkeys.CatMenu.DefaultMultiShow
member.summary: Default MultiShow value for all new CatMenu instances.

member.name: P:Catkeys.CatMenu.ModalAlways
member.summary: If true, Show() always waits until the menu is closed. If false, does not wait if the thread has a message loop (Application.MessageLoop==true).

member.name: P:Catkeys.CatMenu.ActivateMenuWindow
member.summary: Activate the menu window. It enables selecting menu items with the keyboard (arrows, Tab, Enter, etc). If false, only Esc works, it closes the menu. If the menu is owned by a control or toolbar button, keyboard navigation works in any case, don't need this property to enable it.

member.name: P:Catkeys.CatMenu.DefaultActivateMenuWindow
member.summary: Default ActivateMenuWindow value for CatMenu instances. A CatMenu instance inherits this at the moment it is created.

member.name: P:Catkeys.CatMenu.MouseClosingDistance
member.summary: Close the menu when the mouse cursor moves away from it to this distance, pixels. At first the mouse must be or move at less than half of the distance. Default is equal to CatMenu.DefaultMouseClosingDistance, default 200.

member.name: P:Catkeys.CatMenu.DefaultMouseClosingDistance
member.summary: Default MouseClosingDistance value of CatMenu instances. A CatMenu instance inherits this at the moment it is created.

member.name: M:Catkeys.CatMenu.Close
member.summary: Closes the menu and its submenus. Also closes its context menu (CMS.ContextMenu).

member.name: M:Catkeys.Mouse.Move(System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Moves the cursor (mouse pointer) to the specified position in screen.
member.param: Coordinates in screen.
member.exception: The specified x y is not in screen. No exception if Options.Relaxed is true (then moves to a screen edge).

Failed to move to the specified x y. Some reasons: 1. Another thread blocks or modifies mouse input (API BlockInput, mouse hooks, frequent API SendInput etc); 2. The active window belongs to a process of higher UAC integrity level; 3. Some application called API ClipCursor. No exception if Options.Relaxed is true (then final cursor position is undefined).
member.remarks: Uses Options.MouseMoveSpeed, Options.MouseClickSleep (sleeps Math.Min(Options.MouseClickSleep, 7)), Options.Relaxed.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Mouse.LastMoveXY
member.summary: Mouse cursor position of the most recent successful 'mouse move' or 'mouse move and click' function call in this thread. If such functions are still not called in this thread, returns .

member.summary: Moves the cursor (mouse pointer) relative to . Returns the final cursor position in primary screen coordinates.

Y offset from LastMoveXY.Y.
member.exception: The calculated x y is not in screen. No exception if Options.Relaxed is true (then moves to a screen edge).

Failed to move to the calculated x y. Some reasons: 1. Another thread blocks or modifies mouse input (API BlockInput, mouse hooks, frequent API SendInput etc); 2. The active window belongs to a process of higher UAC integrity level; 3. Some application called API ClipCursor. No exception if Options.Relaxed is true (then final cursor position is undefined).
member.remarks: Uses Options.MouseMoveSpeed, Options.MouseClickSleep (sleeps Math.Min(Options.MouseClickSleep, 7)), Options.Relaxed.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Mouse.MoveRecorded(System.String,System.Double)
member.summary: Plays recorded mouse movements, relative to . Returns the final cursor position in primary screen coordinates.
member.param: String containing mouse movement data recorded by a recorder tool that uses .
Speed factor. For example, 0.5 makes 2 times faster.
member.exception: The string is not compatible with this library version (recorded with a newer version and has additional options).
The last x y is not in screen. No exception if Options.Relaxed is true (then moves to a screen edge).

Failed to move to the last x y. Some reasons: 1. Another thread blocks or modifies mouse input (API BlockInput, mouse hooks, frequent API SendInput etc); 2. The active window belongs to a process of higher UAC integrity level; 3. Some application called API ClipCursor. No exception if Options.Relaxed is true (then final cursor position is undefined).
member.remarks: Uses Options.MouseClickSleep (sleeps Math.Min(Options.MouseClickSleep, 7) after each movement, except if recorded with sleep times), Options.Relaxed (for the last movement; does not care about intermediate movements). Does not use Options.MouseMoveSpeed.

member.summary: Calls Api.SendInput to send single mouse movement or/and button down or up or wheel event. Converts x, y and wheelTicks as need for MOUSEINPUT. For X buttons use Api.IMFlag.XDown|Api.IMFlag.X1 etc. If Api.IMFlag.Move, adds Api.IMFlag.Absolute.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Mouse._SleepMax(System.Int32)

member.name: M:Catkeys.Mouse._SleepExact(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calls Time.SleepDoEvents().

member.name: M:Catkeys.Mouse.ClickEx(Catkeys.Types.MButton,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clicks, double-clicks, presses or releases a mouse button. By default does not move the mouse cursor.
member.param: Button and action. Default: left click.

Use . It is the mouse cursor position set by the most recent 'mouse move' or 'mouse move and click' function called in this thread. Use this option for reliability. Example: Mouse.Move(100, 100); Mouse.ClickEx(..., true);. The click is always at 100 100, even if somebody changes cursor position between Mouse.Move sets it and Mouse.ClickEx uses it. In such case this option atomically moves the cursor to LastMoveXY. This movement is instant and does not use Options.MouseMoveSpeed and Options.MouseClickSleep. If false (default), clicks at the current cursor position (does not move it).
member.exception: Invalid button flags (multiple buttons or actions specified).
member.remarks: The return value can be used to auto-release pressed button. See example with .

x y is not in the window (read more in Remarks).
member.remarks: If after moving the cursor it is not in window w or a window of its thread, activates w (or its top-level parent window). Throws exception if then x y is still not in w. Skips all this when just releasing button or if Options.Relaxed is true. Also, if w is a control, x y can be somewhere else in its top-level parent window. The return value can be used to auto-release pressed button. See example with .

Where to write the data. Can be any valid memory of specified size, for example a struct address.
resultBuffer memory size. Note: this function will damage process memory if using bad resultBuffer or bufferSize.
0 or index of first character of hex-encoded substring in s.
member.remarks: Skips spaces and other non-hex-digit characters. Example: "01 23 46 67" is the same as "01234667". The number of hex-digit characters should be divisible by 2, else the last character is ignored.

member.summary: Converts Base64 ANSI string to binary data (bytes). Stores it in caller's memory buffer. Returns the number of bytes stored in resultBuffer.
member.param: Base64 string. Can be null if len is 0.
s length (bytes).
A memory buffer for the result bytes. Must be of at least bufferSize size, else this function will damage process memory.
resultBuffer buffer length (bytes). Must be at least (int)(len * 3L / 4), else exception.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Convert_.Base64Decode(System.Char*,System.Int32,System.Void*,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts Base64 UTF-16 string to binary data (bytes). Stores it in caller's memory buffer. Returns the number of bytes stored in resultBuffer.
member.param: Base64 string. Can be null if len is 0.
s length (characters).
A memory buffer for the result bytes. Must be of at least bufferSize size, else this function will damage process memory.
resultBuffer buffer size (bytes). Must be at least (int)(len * 3L / 4), else exception.
member.remarks: How it is different than Convert.FromBase64String: 1. Allows (discards) non-base64 characters. 2. Supports URL-safe characters: '-' for '+' and '_' for '/'. 3. No exception when string length is not multiple of 4, eg if does not contain '=' characters for padding. 4. Faster.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Convert_.Base64Decode(System.String,System.Void*,System.Int32,System.Int32)

member.param: Base64 string. Can be null, then returns null.
A memory buffer for the result bytes. Must be of at least bufferSize size, else this function will damage process memory.
resultBuffer buffer size (bytes). Must be at least (int)(len * 3L / 4), else exception.
0 or index of first character of Base64 substring in s.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Convert_.Base64Decode(System.String)
member.summary: Converts Base64 string to binary data (bytes). Returns byte[] containing the data.
member.param: Base64 string. Can be null, then returns null.
member.remarks:
How it is different than Convert.FromBase64String: 1. Allows (discards) non-base64 characters. 2. Supports URL-safe characters: '-' for '+' and '_' for '/'. 3. No exception when string length is not multiple of 4, eg if does not contain '=' characters for padding. 4. Faster.
This library does not have Base64-encode functions. Use . See also . It does the same, but does not support some parameter types (char*, ANSI string, byte* buffer) that are used internally in this libray and related software, that is why these library functions were created.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Convert_.Utf8LengthFromString(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the number of bytes that would by produced by converting C# string to UTF8, not including the terminating '\0' character.
member.param: C# string (UTF16). Can be null.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Convert_.Utf8FromString(System.String,System.Byte*,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts C# string to '\0'-terminated UTF8 string. Stores the UTF8 string in caller's buffer. Returns UTF8 string length in bytes, not including the terminating '\0' character. If fails (unlikely if passed correct arguments), returns 0 and sets buffer="".
member.param: C# string (UTF16). Can be null.
Caller-allocated memory of bufLen length.
buffer length in bytes. Should be at least +1, else converts only part of string. The maximal possible required buffer length for whole string can be s.Length*3+1.
member.remarks: Calls API WideCharToMultiByte. This is the most low-level and therefore fastest overload. Does not allocate any memory. With big strings much faster than .NET Encoding class functions. Use buffer/bufLen carefully. If bufLen is greater that the memory buffer length, other memory will be overwritten/damaged.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Convert_.Utf8FromString(System.String)
member.summary: Converts C# string to '\0'-terminated UTF8 string.
member.param: C# string (UTF16). If null, returns null.
member.remarks: How this is different from .NET Encoding class functions: 1. Uses WideCharToMultiByte. 2. Faster with big strings. 3. The returned string is '\0'-terminated. 4. No exceptions (unless the string is so large that fails to allocate so much memory).

member.name: M:Catkeys.Convert_.LibUtf8FromString(System.String,System.WeakReference{System.Byte[]}@,System.Int32*,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts C# string to '\0'-terminated UTF8 string managed by a WeakReference variable.
member.param: C# string (UTF16). If null, returns null, unless allocExtraBytes is not 0.
A WeakReference variable (probably [ThreadStatic]) that manages the returned array. If null, this function will create it.
If not null, receives UTF8 text length, not including '\0' and allocExtraBytes.
Allocate this number of extra bytes after the string.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Convert_.Utf8ToStringLength(System.Byte*,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the number of characters that would by produced by converting UTF8 to C# string. The terminating '\0' character is not included in the return value.
member.param: UTF8 string. Can be null.
Length of utf8 or part of it. If negative, the function finds utf8 length; then utf8 must be '\0'-terminated.
member.remarks: Uses API MultiByteToWideChar. There is no overload that takes byte[], because for it can be used .NET Encoding class functions.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Convert_.Utf8ToString(System.Byte*,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts UTF8 string to C# string (which is UTF16). The terminating '\0' character is not included in the returned string.
member.param: UTF8 string. If null, returns null.
Length of utf8 or part of it. If negative, the function finds utf8 length; then utf8 must be '\0'-terminated.
member.remarks: Uses API MultiByteToWideChar. There is no overload that takes byte[], because for it can be used .NET Encoding class functions. The speed is similar; this is slower with short strings but faster with long strings.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Debug_
member.summary: Functions useful to debug code.
member.remarks: The PrintX functions write to the same output as , not to the trace listeners like etc do. Also they add caller's name, file and line number. Functions Print, PrintIf, PrintFunc and Dialog work only if DEBUG is defined, which normally is when the caller project is in Debug configuration. Else they are not called, and arguments not evaluated at run time. This is because they have [("DEBUG")]. Note: when used in a library, the above functions depend on DEBUG of the library project and not on DEBUG of the consumer project of the library. For example, the library may be in Release configuration even if its consumer project is in Debug configuration. If your library wants to show some info only if its consumer project is in Debug config, instead you can use code like if(Options.Debug) Output.Warning("text");; see , .

member.name: P:Catkeys.Output.Writer
member.summary: Gets or sets object that actually writes text when is called Output.Write, Print and similar functions.
member.remarks: If you want to redirect, modify or just monitor output text, use code like in the example. It is known as "output redirection". Redirection is applied to whole appdomain, and does not affect other appdomains. Redirection affects Output.Write, Print and similar functions, also Output.RedirectConsoleOutput and Output.RedirectDebugOutput. It does not affect Output.WriteDirectly and Output.Clear. Don't call Output.Write, Print etc in method WriteLine(string) of your writer class. It would call itself and create stack overflow. But you can call Output.WriteDirectly.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Output._OutputWriter
member.summary: Our default writer class for the Writer property.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Output.WriteDirectly(System.String)
member.summary: Writes string value + "\r\n" to the output window or console (if ) or log file (if not null). Unlike Output.Write, Print etc, the string is not passed to .

member.name: P:Catkeys.Output.RedirectConsoleOutput
member.summary: Let Console.WriteX methods in non-console process write to the same destination as Output.Write etc.
member.remarks: Console.Write will write line, like Console.WriteLine. Console.Clear will not clear output; it will throw exception.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Output.RedirectDebugOutput
member.summary: Let Debug.WriteX and Trace.WriteX methods write to the same destination as Output.Write etc.
member.remarks: Tip: To write to the output window even in console process, set Output.IgnoreConsole=true; before calling this method first time.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Output.LogFile
member.summary: Sets log file path. When set (not null), text passed to Output.Write, Print and similar functions will be written to the file. Assuming that is not changed. If value is null - restores default behavior.
member.remarks:
The first Write etc call (in this appdomain) creates or opens the file and deletes old content if the file already exists. Multiple appdomains cannot use the same file. If the file is open for writing, Write makes unique filename and changes LogFile value.
Also supports mailslots. For LogFile use mailslot name, as documented in CreateMailslot. Multiple appdomains and processes can use the same mailslot.
member.exception: The 'set' function throws this exception if the value is not full path and not null.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Output.LogFileTimestamp
member.summary: Let Write etc also add current time when using log file (see ). The time is local, not UTC.
