member.name: M:Catkeys.Wnd.Find(System.String,System.String,Catkeys.Types.WFOwner,Catkeys.Types.WFFlags,System.Func{Catkeys.Wnd,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Finds a top-level window and returns its handle as Wnd. Returns default(Wnd) if not found. To check it you can use or (see examples).
member.param: Window name. Usually it is the title bar text. String format: wildcard expression. null means 'can be any'. "" means 'must not have name'.
Window class name. String format: wildcard expression. null means 'can be any'. Cannot be "".

Depends on type and flags:
null - can be any program etc.
string - program file name without ".exe". Cannot be "". String format: wildcard expression.
Wnd - owner window. See .
int, uint - process id. See , .
Lambda etc callback function to call for each matching window. It can evaluate more properties of the window and return true when they match. Example: also: t => t.HasStyle(Native.WS_CAPTION).
member.remarks: If there are multiple matching windows, gets the first in the Z order matching window, preferring visible windows. On Windows 8 and later finds only desktop windows, not Windows Store app Metro-style windows (on Windows 10 only few such windows exist), unless this process has uiAccess; to find such windows you can use FindFast. To find message-only windows use instead.
member.exception: className is "". To match any, use null. programEtc is "" or 0. To match any, use null. Actually this exception is thrown when constructing the WFOwner object (before calling this function), which usually is implicit and therefore it seems like the exception is thrown by this function. programEtc argument type is not string/Wnd/int/uint/null. Invalid wildcard expression ("**options|" or regular expression).

member.name: P:Catkeys.Wnd.LastFind
member.summary: Gets arguments and result of this thread's last call to or .
member.remarks: WaitFor.WindowActive and similar functions don't change this property. and some other functions of this library change this property because they call internally.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Wnd.FindAll(System.String,System.String,Catkeys.Types.WFOwner,Catkeys.Types.WFFlags,System.Func{Catkeys.Wnd,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Finds all matching windows. Returns array containing 0 or more window handles as Wnd. Everything except the return type is the same as with .
member.remarks: The list is sorted to match the Z order, however hidden windows (when using WFFlags.HiddenToo) are always after visible windows.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Wnd.FindFast(System.String,System.String,Catkeys.Wnd)
member.summary: Finds a top-level window and returns its handle as Wnd. Returns default(Wnd) if not found. To check it you can use or . Calls API FindWindowEx. Faster than Find, which uses API EnumWindows. Can be used only when you know full name and/or class name. Finds hidden windows too.
member.param: Name. Use null to match any. Full, case-insensitive. Wildcard etc not supported.
Class name. Use null to match any. Cannot be "". Full, case-insensitive. Wildcard etc not supported.
If used, starts searching from the next window in the Z order.
member.remarks: To find message-only windows use instead. Supports . It is not recommended to use this function in a loop to enumerate windows. It would be unreliable because window positions in the Z order can be changed while enumerating. Also then it would be slower than Find and FindAll.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Wnd.FindOrRun(System.String,System.String,Catkeys.Types.WFOwner,Catkeys.Types.WFFlags,System.Func{Catkeys.Wnd,System.Boolean},System.Func{System.Int32},System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Finds a top-level window. If found, activates (optionally), else calls callback function that should open the window (eg call ) and waits for the window. Returns window handle as Wnd. Returns default(Wnd) if not found (if runWaitTimeoutS is negative; else exception). The first 5 parameters are the same as .
member.param: Callback function's delegate. See example.
How long to wait for the window after calling the callback function. Seconds. Default 60. See .
Finally the window must be active. For more info see the algorithm in Remarks.

example.code: Wnd w = Wnd.FindOrRun("* Notepad", run: () => Shell.Run("notepad.exe")); Print(w);

member.name: T:Catkeys.Wnd._WndList
member.summary: An enumerable list of Wnd for and . Holds Util.LibArrayBuilder or IEnumerator or single Wnd or none. Must be disposed if it is Util.LibArrayBuilder or IEnumerator, else disposing is optional.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Wnd.WndOwner
member.summary: Gets or sets the owner window of this top-level window. A window that has an owner window is always on top of its owner window. Don't call this for controls, they don't have an owner window. The 'get' function supports . The 'set' function can fail, eg if the owner's process has higher UAC integrity level.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Wnd.WndWindow
member.summary: Gets the top-level parent window of this control. If this is a top-level window, returns this. Returns default(Wnd) if this is invalid. Calls API GetAncestor(GA_ROOT). Unlike the API, this function does not return default(Wnd) when this is Misc.WndRoot.
member.remarks: Supports .

member.name: P:Catkeys.Wnd.IsChildWindow
member.summary: Returns true if this is a child window (control), false if top-level window.
member.remarks: Supports . Uses . Another way is w.HasStyle(Native.WS_CHILD). It is faster but less reliable, because some top-level windows have WS_CHILD style and some child windows don't.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Wnd.IsChildOf(Catkeys.Wnd)

member.name: P:Catkeys.Wnd.WndDirectParent
member.summary: Gets the window or control that is the direct parent of this control. Returns default(Wnd) if this is a top-level window. If you need the top-level parent window, use instead.
member.remarks: Supports .

member.name: P:Catkeys.Wnd.WndDirectParentOrOwner
member.summary: Gets the window or control that is the direct parent of this control or owner of this top-level window. Calls API GetParent. Faster than .
member.remarks: Supports .

member.name: P:Catkeys.Wnd.WndFirstSibling
member.summary: Gets the window of the same type that is highest in the Z order. If this is a top-level window, gets first top-level window, else gets first control of the same direct parent. If this is the first, returns this, not default(Wnd). Calls API GetWindow(this, GW_HWNDFIRST).
member.remarks: Supports .

member.name: P:Catkeys.Wnd.WndLastSibling
member.summary: Gets the window of the same type that is lowest in the Z order. If this is a top-level window, gets last top-level window, else gets last control of the same direct parent. If this is the last, returns this, not default(Wnd). Calls API GetWindow(this, GW_HWNDLAST).
member.remarks: Supports .

member.name: P:Catkeys.Wnd.WndNext
member.summary: Gets the window of the same type that is next (below this) in the Z order. If this is a top-level window, gets next top-level window, else gets next control of the same direct parent. If this is the last, returns default(Wnd). Calls API GetWindow(this, GW_HWNDNEXT).
member.remarks: Supports .

member.name: P:Catkeys.Wnd.WndPrev
member.summary: Gets the window of the same type that is previous (above this) in the Z order. If this is a top-level window, gets previous top-level window, else gets previous control of the same direct parent. If this is the first, returns default(Wnd). Calls API GetWindow(this, GW_HWNDPREV).
member.remarks: Supports .

member.name: P:Catkeys.Wnd.WndFirstChild

member.remarks: Supports .

member.name: P:Catkeys.Wnd.WndLastChild
member.summary: Gets the child control at the bottom of the Z order. Returns default(Wnd) if no children.
member.remarks: Supports .

member.name: M:Catkeys.Wnd.WndNextMain(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets next window in the Z order, skipping invisible and other windows that would not be added to taskbar or not activated by Alt+Tab. Returns default(Wnd) if there are no such windows. If this is default(Wnd), starts from the top of the Z order.
member.param: If this is not default(Wnd) and there are no matching windows after it, retry from the top of the Z order. Like Alt+Tab does. Can return wFrom.
Skip minimized windows.
On Windows 10 include windows on all virtual desktops. On Windows 8 include Windows Store apps (only if this process has UAC integrity level uiAccess).

Emulate Alt+Tab behavior with owned windows (message boxes, dialogs): If this is such owned window, skip its owner. If the found window has an owned window that was active more recently, return that owned window.
member.remarks: This function is quite slow and does not exactly match the behavior of the Windows taskbar and Alt+Tab.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Registry_.ParseKeyString(System.String@)
member.summary: Parses registry key string and returns hive as RegistryKey. If key starts with "HKEY_", removes hive name from it and returns that hive. For example, if key is @"HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Test", sets key=@"Software\Test" and returns Registry.LocalMachine. Else if key is null or @"\", sets key=Registry_.CatkeysKey (@"Software\Catkeys\User") and returns Registry.CurrentUser. Else if key starts with @"\", prepends Registry_.CatkeysKey (@"Software\Catkeys\User") and returns Registry.CurrentUser. Else just returns Registry.CurrentUser. Valid hive names: "HKEY_CURRENT_USER", "HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE", "HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT", "HKEY_USERS", "HKEY_PERFORMANCE_DATA" or "HKEY_CURRENT_CONFIG".
member.param: Registry key. Can start with a hive name.
member.exception: 'key' starts with "HKEY_" but it is an invalid hive name.

member.param: Can be: Path of any file or folder. URL, like "http://..." or "mailto:a@b.c" or "file:///path". ITEMIDLIST like ":: HexEncodedITEMIDLIST". It can be of any file, folder, URL or virtual object like Control Panel. See . Shell object parsing name, like @"::{CLSID-1}\::{CLSID-2}" or "shell:AppsFolder\WinStoreAppId". File type like ".txt" or URL protocol like "http:". If it is a file containing multiple icons (eg exe, dll), can be specified icon index like "path,index" or native icon resource id like "path,-id". If not full path, the function will look in . Supports environment variables (see ).
Icon width and height. Also can be enum , cast to int.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Icons.AsyncIcons
member.summary: Gets file icons asynchronously. Use to avoid waiting until all icons are extracted before displaying them in a UI (menu etc). Instead you show the UI without icons, and then asynchronously receive icons when they are extracted. At first call for each file. Then call GetAllAsync. Create a callback function of type and pass its delegate to GetAllAsync.

member.summary: Adds a file path to an internal collection.
member.param: File path etc to pass to .
Something to pass to your callback function together with icon handle for this file.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Icons.AsyncIcons.Add(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Catkeys.Icons.AsyncIn})
member.summary: Adds multiple file paths to an internal collection. The same as calling Add(string, object) multiple times. This function copies the list.

member.summary: Gets the number of items added with Add(). GetAllAsync() sets it = 0.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Icons.AsyncIcons.GetAllAsync(Catkeys.Icons.AsyncCallback,System.Int32,Catkeys.Types.GIFlags,System.Object)
member.summary: Starts getting icons of files added with Add(). After this function returns, icons are asynchronously extracted with , and callback called with icon handle (or Zero if failed). The callback is called in this thread. This thread must have a message loop (eg Application.Run()). If you'll need more icons, you can call Add() and GetAllAsync() again with the same AsyncIcons instance, even if getting old icons if still not finished.
member.param: A callback function delegate.
Icon width and height. Also can be enum , cast to int.
Something to pass to callback functions.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Icons.FileIconCache.GetImage(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets file icon as Bitmap. If it is in the memory cache, gets it from there. Else if it is in the file cache, gets it from there and adds to the memory cache. Else gets from file (uses and adds to the file cache and to the memory cache. Returns null if GetFileIconImage failed, eg file does not exist.
member.param: Any file or folder.

Get file type icon, depending on filename extension. Use this to avoid getting separate image object for each file of same type. This is ignored if filename extension is ".ico" or ".exe" or starts with ".exe," or ".dll,".
member.remarks: Thread-safe. The variable can be static, and this function can be called from any thread without locking.

member.name: T:System.ValueTuple
member.summary: The ValueTuple types (from arity 0 to 8) comprise the runtime implementation that underlies tuples in C# and struct tuples in F#. Aside from created via language syntax, they are most easily created via the ValueTuple.Create factory methods. The System.ValueTuple types differ from the System.Tuple types in that: - they are structs rather than classes, - they are mutable rather than readonly, and - their members (such as Item1, Item2, etc) are fields rather than properties.

Returns if the current instance is equal to the specified object; otherwise, . This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the instance is cast to an interface.
The implementation is called only if other is not , and if it can be successfully cast (in C#) or converted (in Visual Basic) to a whose components are of the same types as those of the current instance. The IStructuralEquatable.Equals(Object,IEqualityComparer) method first passes the values of the objects to be compared to the implementation. If this method call returns , the method is called again and passed the values of the two instances.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TupleElementNamesAttribute
member.summary: Indicates that the use of on a member is meant to be treated as a tuple with element names.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TupleElementNamesAttribute.#ctor(System.String[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Specifies, in a pre-order depth-first traversal of a type's construction, which occurrences are meant to carry element names.
member.remarks: This constructor is meant to be used on types that contain an instantiation of that contains element names. For instance, if C is a generic type with two type parameters, then a use of the constructed type C{, might be intended to treat the first type argument as a tuple with element names and the second as a tuple without element names. In which case, the appropriate attribute specification should use a transformNames value of { "name1", "name2", null, null, null }.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TupleElementNamesAttribute.TransformNames
member.summary: Specifies, in a pre-order depth-first traversal of a type's construction, which elements are meant to carry element names.
